results.title: Marketing Designer
results.description:
About Ergeon

We are disrupting the trillion-dollar construction industry with technology, making it possible for almost any profession to operate remotely. Our company is the only startup combining the strengths of technology and remote work to solve the challenges of residential construction.¬†

Unlike most other products and services, hiring a contractor for a home improvement project is very far from a 1-click experience today. Ergeon aims to empower skilled local contractors with human and technology-powered services to make home improvement easy. We take a full-stack approach to create a seamless experience for homeowners, and leverage technology to scale the front & back offices of contractors.

With the belief that everyone has a right to professional growth and respect regardless of their location, we proudly have staff (aka¬†Ergeoneers) in over 40 countries, with a great score and recommendation rating on Glassdoor. Come join us to make construction friendly and accessible!

¬†

Ergeon: [er - g- eon]

Erg = unit of work or energy

Eon = billion years

¬†

Ergeon is founded by CS Ph.D. serial entrepreneurs Jiayue (Jenny) He and Odysseas Tstatalos. They picked this name to symbolize their joint passion for using tech to revolutionize work.¬†

¬†
Overview of the Role

A Marketing Designer at Ergeon is a specialist in graphic design. You will bring the marketing vision to life.

As a designer, you will consider Ergeon‚Äôs brand to ensure that the outputs are in line with our brand identity.¬† The role asks that you use illustration, composition, color and images to create digital and print collateral.

  • Design/develop collateral for emails, blog posts, landing pages, online promotions and website pages
  • Create promotional advertisements for social media platforms such as Facebook, Instagram, etc.
Desired Skills and Experience
Must have
  • 2+ years of experience as a designer
  • Post-secondary education, Bachelor's degree or higher
  • Strong print and layout design ability/fundamentals, understands the brief and execute
  • Artistic, analytical
  • Uses software like Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator
  • Uses google suites, primarily google docs
  • Work independently and efficiently
Nice to have
  • Experience with digital marketing/advertising
  • Experience with inDesign and/or Figma
  • HTML coding

¬†

Technical Requirements

Good Laptop setup with Chrome browser

  • Minimum of 8GB RAM
  • Minimum processor:
    • For Intel variants of CPUs:
      • Core i3 8000 Series (8th Gen) or higher
      • Pentium N5000 series (Quad-core variant) or higher
      • Celeron J5000 series or higher (quad-core variant)
    • For AMD variants of CPUs:
      • Ryzen 3, 3rd generation or higher

¬†

Stable high-speed internet connection

  • At least 5mbps upload and 20 Mbps download

¬†

Headset

  • With a noise cancelling microphone

¬†

Power backup

  • 250-300W UPS

¬†

Data availability

  • Ability to access up to 1.5GB of data per day during storm outages
¬†
Compensation

Hourly rate between $12.5 - $14.5 USD, depending on experience and location.

  • Your final compensation will depend on your placement on our Career Ladder and will be calculated hourly.
  • You'll be paid weekly through Upwork (www.upwork.com), the platform we choose to hire and pay our Ergeoneers all over the world.
¬†
Additional important information

¬†

Availability
  • This position is part-time with expectations of at least 20 hours per week.
¬†
Ergeon‚Äôs benefits and perks for full staff members

Competitive compensation:¬†We invest in people! We are constantly doing worldwide market research in order to offer globally competitive salaries. And we are well funded by VCs.

¬†¬†All-Remote since the beginning:¬†We have a diverse team spread across 40+ countries. We stay connected through the best remote work practices such as flexible work hours, team events, remote happy hours, and by sharing¬†our love of food!

¬†¬†¬†¬†Tech, Wellness & Learning fund: You can have a $400USD bonus per year for software and hardware tools, workplace improvements, fitness-related spending (includes things like yoga classes, Fitbit tracker, new running shoes, gym membership. . .), and books, courses, training, or even attending conferences.

¬† Stock options:¬†All staff is eligible after 6 months of¬†full-time¬†work.

¬†¬†Birthday Paid day off:¬†You can take the exact day, or Friday before if it is on a weekend!

¬†¬†Flexible Paid time off:¬†You can take 12 days after working 6 months, PLUS 2 extra days per year for a maximum of 20 days.

¬†¬†Free Headset Benefit:¬†You can get a noise-canceling headset since your first day working¬†full-time.

¬† Equipment:¬†Laptop replacement after 1 year of¬†full-time¬†work. And every 3 years after that.

¬†¬† Co-Working Fund:¬†Meet in groups of 3+ Ergeon friends and get reimbursed up to USD $20 for coffee, co-working, etc (once per quarter).

We believe everyone has a right to professional growth and respect, no matter their location.

Ergeon‚Äôs workforce is given meaningful opportunities and is supported by a kind and diverse community.

Our global staff (Ergeoneers) have access to career growth, amazing work culture, and great benefits.

Come join us to transform the construction industry!

As merchants seek ways to drive more direct sales and distribution through their channels and move away from a reliance on traditional online marketing strategies, Recharge has made it possible to grow businesses with seamless, recurring customer transactions.

Bootstrapped until 2020, Recharge is valued at over 2.1B dollars and is a double unicorn with a total raise of 277M dollars. Join us as we work with our merchants to define the future of ecommerce.

results.description:

results.title: UX/UI Lead
results.description:
Spacewell is looking for a hands-on and experienced UX/UI Lead for our local offices in Eindhoven or Wilrijk. You will define, implement and execute our UX/UI strategy. You will do this working closely with product management, development, commercial colleagues and our (potential) customers. Together with our Product Leadership you will act as a change agent in our transformation in becoming a full product driven company with a UX-first approach. You area true motivator and are able to get our teams excited as well! Are we speaking about you? Reach out!

A day on the job

  • 8.45 AM: You arrive at the office and open your mailbox. Right away, you have a Teams call with two of your colleagues from India. During this call you make sure they are up to date with the newest information about the UX/UI strategy.
  • 10.00 AM: Afterwards, you make yourself ready to give a short training to the (junior) UX/UI Designers with tips and tricks.
  • 10.45 AM: Because you are overall responsible for the product's UX, you play an important role in our product discovery processes, you meet up with your colleagues from product management to discuss the latest requirements
  • 11 AM: Time to fill up your cup of coffee!
  • 11.30 AM: You work on a training for our product managers/owners, developers and designers for using different methods, tools and Figma.
  • Noon: Lunch time!
  • 1 PM: You are also responsible to guide our product teams incorporating UX within their way of working.
  • 14.30 PM: You start with working out a new UX/UI strategy to implement.
  • 4 PM: You work on a set of high-fidelity mockups for the user stories assigned to you. Once the framework is clear, you assign the work to one of the team members.

What about the team?

As a UX/UI Lead you get to be a part of a dynamic and warm team of international direct colleagues. They understand the challenges that come with the job, and they are there to cheer you on when needed. Besides that, your colleagues all have a different background and diverse reference frameworks. This allows you to learn a lot on the job, both in terms of hard and soft skills. Depending on your evolution, expectations and what energizes you, a career path can be developed to measure.

Could this be you?

  • You have at least 3 years of experience working as a UX/UI Designer in product organizations.
  • You have university grade education (Bachelor or Master) preferably in Design.
  • You speak English fluently.
  • You are experienced with setting up an UX/UI strategy from scratch, design thinking and tools like validation patterns, Figma etc.
  • Working in an agile environment and using Scrum is not new for you.
  • You want to grow and learn within your expertise field.
  • You can bring your innovative vision to other people and have a sense of ownership.
  • You have the capacity to guide people and merge several products into one new product portfolio.

The challenges we see in this role

  • Spacewell is a company in full transition. At times this results in organized chaos. However, we stand together as a team to make sense of what's going on and to find meaning in each situation.
  • You're willing to learn, as you will carry out a diverse range of tasks for multiple regions. By linking different pieces of information together, you're easily able to get an idea of the bigger picture and to put things into perspective.
  • You're not afraid to speak up in case you have questions. You have a sense of responsibility and ownership, so that you know when to escalate (potential) issues, when to treat information in a confidential way.

How do we make this a win-win?

  • You get to be a part of a quick, innovative, dynamic and warm team of colleagues with different backgrounds and reference frameworks.
  • Your colleagues understand your challenges,¬† will help you along the way and appreciate your hard work.
  • You really get the chance to make a difference and to grow together with your colleagues. Such as, for example, our own Spacewell Academy and following LinkedIn Trainings.
  • Next to the flexible work hours and remote working possibilities, you will get a salary and fringe benefits in line with your experience.

What would next steps look like?

  1. You reach out to our recruitment team to send in your CV or to ask some further questions.
  2. You will be invited for a digital cup of coffee.
  3. Depending on locations and schedules, you will meet up with your future colleagues at our offices or virtually.

¬†

¬†

We quietly launched in May 2020, and have helped A¬∑Teamers earn $11.4+ million since.

As part of A¬∑Team, you can expect:

  • High-paying, meaningful missions with the most audacious companies¬†sent your way; generally $110-$190/hr, with vetted, fascinating clients doing work that matters. We're picky about who we partner with; new clients only come in via trusted referral. We've worked with Lyft, McGraw Hill, ClearCo, irl.com, the former CEO of Waze, the leading vaccine production software, several new unicorns we can't say here, and dozens of startups backed by a16z/YC/Softbank/etc.

How to apply:

Go here:¬†https://build.a.team/remotivedesignerreferral¬†+ mention Remotive.¬†No resume or cover letter needed; we respect your time so the application is short. We're also much more interested in seeing what you've made, and excited to chat more if there‚Äôs a fit.

What you‚Äôll do:

Take your pick from early-stage incubations with world-class founders, to fast-growing super-funded companies, to old school non-tech incumbents looking to build as a tech giant would

  • Missions usually involve building an ambitious piece of software from 0 to 1 as part of a small 3-4 person team.¬†

  • You‚Äôll be paid to scope it out, give the client options, guide strategy, and execute on the selected solution. Sometimes the client has a clear vision, sometimes not; which is why A.Team builders tend to be senior folks who can work together to find the right direction.¬†

Who A¬∑Team is for:

  • Senior UX/UI Designers who left large companies and high-growth startups to pursue their craft with autonomy.

Who A¬∑Team is¬†not¬†for:

  • People looking for small gigs

Our long-term vision:

A¬∑Team¬†is a new type of company for a new kind of independent software builder. We call them "unhirables": people who traditional companies couldn‚Äôt hire full-time even if they wanted to, but who want to do their most meaningful work with their favorite people in small, autonomous, distributed expert teams.¬†

To help us secure amazing missions, we raised $5 million+ (not public, yet) from NFX, Village Global, and Box Group, along with the former CEO of Upwork, the founders of Fiverr and Lemonade, Apple's Global Head of Recruiting, YC Partner Aaron Harris, Wharton's Adam Grant, and Duke's Dan Ariely.

results.title: Senior Product Designer, Merchant Risk Experience
results.description:
Company Description

Since we opened our doors in 2009, the world of commerce has evolved immensely, and so has Square. After enabling anyone to take payments and never miss a sale, we saw sellers stymied by disparate, outmoded products and tools that wouldn‚Äôt work together.

To solve this problem, we expanded into software and built integrated solutions to help sellers sell online, manage inventory, book appointments, engage loyal buyers, and hire and pay staff. Across it all, we‚Äôve embedded financial services tools at the point of sale, so merchants can access a business loan and manage their cash flow in one place. Afterpay furthers our goal to provide omnichannel tools that unlock meaningful value and growth, enabling sellers to capture the next generation shopper, increase order sizes, and compete at a larger scale.

Today, we are a partner to sellers of all sizes ‚Äì large, enterprise-scale businesses with complex operations, sellers just starting, as well as merchants who began selling with Square and have grown larger over time. As our sellers grow, so do our solutions. There is a massive opportunity in front of us. We‚Äôre building a significant, meaningful, and lasting business, and we are helping sellers worldwide do the same.

Job Description

The Risk team works to protect the people that trust Square, by minimizing the financial risks that come with running a business. We keep our sellers safe while $25B+ flows through Square annually, and along the way help each other make calculated risk/reward trade offs to grow sellers, and make complicated and sometimes painful processes understandable to all.¬†

We are looking for a Product Designer to join Risk in delivering critical knowledge and experiences to our sellers that help them make sense of these complex situations in money movement‚Äîgetting sellers their money faster and protecting them along the way. You will work alongside other product designers, content designers, product managers, researchers, engineering, and legal to increase usability and ease of use across Risk experiences.



Qualifications

You will:

  • Design from a customer-first perspective, advocating for the customer and approaching problems with an experience mindset.

Experience in service design (Systems Design, UX/UI Design, Organizational Design).

results.title: Marketing Designer
results.description:
About CommandBar

Our software makes other software better. Our flagship product is a magical search bar that lets users find and do anything in the app they‚Äôre using. Today our customers include some of the world‚Äôs most forward-thinking companies like Gusto, Netlify, and AngelList.

We‚Äôre obsessed with helping people get more done with computers. We measure our success as the number of humans we serve. We‚Äôre well funded, have strong early traction, and have an incredibly talented team that's low-ego and spread across the world.

But it‚Äôs still very early days at CommandBar. There‚Äôs a ton of room for you to have an outsized impact and make your mark.

¬†

About the Marketing Designer role

We‚Äôre looking for a talented designer to join our team. You'll help create breakthrough marketing campaigns that shape our brand and bring CommandBar to more of the world. Our customers place a lot of trust in our product (they embed us in their product directly, after all). Your work will help create that trust and establish our company as the place world-class product builders want to work and work with.

Concretely, you‚Äôll work with our Growth team and collaborate with our Product Design Lead to bring our brand marketing efforts to life. You'll also support Sales, Success, and other teams across the organization as needed.

Day to day, you'll work on a variety of marketing-focused projects. You'll design beautiful landing pages and product marketing assets; create gorgeous visuals for our blog and social media channels; and you‚Äôll own design for sales collateral (decks and one-pagers), event marketing (booth assets and swag), and our ads.

¬†

Some things you can expect to do

  • Collaborate with our Product Design Lead to evolve the CommandBar brand.¬†

  • Design award-worthy website experiences that drive impact.¬†

  • Create stunning visual assets for our product launches and content marketing initiatives.¬†

  • Set the bar for a consistent brand experience across all marketing channels.

  • Work with top-notch freelancers to support and extend your capabilities to deliver boundary-pushing creative campaigns.¬†

  • And yes, since we‚Äôre a startup, you‚Äôll also work on things like swag, sales collateral, and ad creatives.

¬†

Skills and experience that will help you succeed

  • A portfolio that showcases strong design fundamentals, including color, typography, layout, and aesthetic taste. Bonus points for motion design.

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.

  • Ability to move ideas forward with little direction.

  • Knowledge of marketing fundamentals, including funnels, user journeys, and channels.¬†

  • Experience working remotely and/or in a fast-paced startup or agency environment.¬†

  • Strong proficiency with at least one modern design tool (we use Figma, Jitter, and Adobe products today).

¬†

What we offer

Overall, we believe in benefits that respect individual choice and reflect the fact that optimizing your life outside of work leads to better performance at work. Benefits include:

  • Competitive salary and equity. For this role the range is $107,000 ‚Äì $150,000 USD per year.¬†¬†

  • 100% employer-paid medical, dental, and vision insurance for you and 50% for your dependents.

  • 401K with matching for US-based employees

  • Flexible PTO with a 3-week minimum

  • 12 weeks of parental leave for all parents

  • A learning and development budget

  • A generous ‚ÄòMake Your Life Easier‚Äô stipend

  • A new laptop and a home office stipend for anything else you need to do your best work.

  • Commuter stipend for teammates based in San Francisco.¬†

  • Four team retreats per year¬† including two at our offices in San Francisco and two at other fun locations. Most recently we met up in Asheville, NC and San Diego, CA.

¬†

What's the interview process like?

Every interview starts the same way: two to three casual conversations with team members so (1) we can get to know you, your background, interests, and career goals and (2) you can learn about CommandBar.

After those conversations take place, we'll agree on a written interview plan that's tailored to your role. Usually this begins with a domain-specific screen (e.g. a coding interview for an engineer, or a portfolio review for a designer) and may include a take-home component if needed.

It's very important to us that our interview process be transparent, as stress-free-as-possible, and gives you an accurate picture of what working at CommandBar is like.


One last note...

Please treat this job description as a starting point for a conversation. If the role sounds interesting, we‚Äôd love for you to apply even if you don‚Äôt think you‚Äôre a perfect fit.

results.title: Senior Product Designer
results.description:
What You'll Do

The Sr. Product Designer designs and develops new products and product improvements by performing the following duties. This position is responsible for taking products from concept through production under aggressive timelines. Must possess some knowledge of molding, plastics, soft goods (not required), printing basics and have a strong focus on the design, aesthetic elements and manufacturability of products.

  • Takes ownership of the entire design and development process of projects assigned.

  • Evaluates, analyzes and makes recommendations for cost improvements to elevate the competitive position of the product and relays this information internally and to overseas operations.
  • Evaluates current and proposed products based on factors such as appealing appearance, design-function relationships, serviceability, materials and production methods application, budget, production costs and specifications.
  • Must be able to assess product obstacles and use design skills and experience to successfully complete the project.
  • Responsible for working closely with the Engineering to develop the product through all phases of development and manufacturing.
  • Responsible for working with Marketing and Branding Teams to drive brand consistency across all products and to establish key design features.
  • Analyzes test data and reports to determine if designs meet functional and performance specifications as well as safety requirements.
  • Performs technical analysis of competitive products.
  • Arranges files or drawings to have prototypes made for in-house evaluation and sales purposes.

Responsibilities

  • Bachelor's degree (B.S.) in Industrial Design is required from a four-year college or university; and six to eight years related experience and/or training.
  • Must have a strong focus on design aesthetics and awareness of brand.
  • Must possess knowledge of manufacturing, various molding techniques (injection, overmolding, blowmolding, rotocast, Compression, etc‚Ä¶), plastics, soft goods and basic printing.
  • Must be highly proficient in Illustrator, Photoshop and Solidworks.
  • Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations regarding safety standards.
  • Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals.
  • Self-motivated, enthusiastic, with excellent time management
  • Manage projects with Intern Students
  • The ability to be able to communicate your ideas clearly

results.title: Senior Manager, Product Design

results.title: Senior Lead, UX
results.description:
Zymewire is growing rapidly, and we're searching for a Senior Lead, UX to join us for the journey!

All about Zymewire:

Zymewire is a Toronto-based SaaS company that has built game-changing technology to help sales teams accelerate revenue growth. Today we're leaders in the life sciences space, but tomorrow we envision becoming the de facto service that sales professionals across all industries rely on to help them make the most informed decisions, take the most immediate action and be the most awesome at their unique jobs.

We carry out our mission through (1) keeping our customers at the heart of everything we do (2) maintaining an unrelenting curiosity about their challenges and work flows¬† (3) constantly innovating¬† (4) learning from each other, supporting each other and having fun while doing it. We're currently a distributed team of 51 (you'd be lucky Zymer #52!), scattered across Canada, the UK, and South America.

Today more than 250 pharmaceutical and biotechnology service providers around the world trust Zymewire for their sales research. Our users are located in over 50 countries around the world and their companies range in size from start-ups to billion-dollar multinationals.

¬†

Reporting directly¬† to the CTO, you will be the authoritative voice of all things UX for the Zymewire product. As the design pillar in the Product, Design, and Engineering trifecta, you will be given wide responsibility to audit, organize and structure the UX of a complex B2B web application. Using your experience, you can identify where in the product the best ROI for UX improvements are and the best approach to get results. Establishing and leading a small UX and Design practice within the organization, you will take the helm in beginning the process of defining a long-term vision for the product experience, the design language, the team's approach to UX and planning and implementing the transformation. Best of all, in this role, you will have the opportunity to work with many other amazing people toward the common goal of solving meaningful problems for our users!

‚Äç

What you'll be responsible for:

-Working closely with a product manager to develop new functionality.

-Working closely with a user interface designer to ensure a great user experience.

-Working closely with front end developers to help bring the design to the user.

-Conducting interviews and experiments with user's to understand their needs and frustrations with their experience.

‚Äç

Who will be successful in this role?‚Äç

-Someone who is able to communicate their decisions clearly using a medium like Figma and can also explain and justify the directions chosen.

-Someone who has experience leading multi-person design projects and coached the other designers.

-Someone who has successfully managed small project teams and is looking to ease into a management role over time.

‚Äç

What we'd love to see in your work history:

-At least undergraduate degree in a relevant field.

-A portfolio that you can share with us.

-Experience with conducting customer interviews.

‚Äç

Why Zymewire? Fancy perks etc.

Location:

Remote, Anywhere in Canada.

results.title: U/X Designer
results.description:
Arch Systems is seeking a talented UX Designer or Product Designer to join our rapidly scaling Product team and help design our products and solutions to make our customers successful. Started by Stanford Engineering PhDs and grown out of non-profit work in Africa, Arch is a venture-backed company working with the world's largest electronics manufacturers.

We combine rich data from all machines, new and legacy, to drive real time and predictive analytics transforming manufacturing efficiency and how we work.

We are looking for talented and driven people who seek a lasting impact both in transforming manufacturing operations as well as making critical industries more efficient, connected, and sustainable. Come join our diverse and passionate team.

What You Will Do:
  • Understand our industry, customers, and users and their pain points and workflows to design intuitive user experiences.
  • Deliver user flows, wireframes, mockups and prototypes to showcase and test user interfaces in a wide range of devices and interfaces.
  • Work with the Product and Engineering teams to ensure the designs created satisfy business requirements and deliver our technology with the best workflows.
  • Proactively collect user feedback through customer calls, surveys, and other methods.
  • Identify design problems and devise elegant solutions.
  • Make strategic design and user-experience decisions related to existing, and new, functions and features.
  • Take a user-centered design approach and rapidly test and iterate your designs.
  • Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.
  • Ask smart questions, take risks and champion new ideas.
What You Bring to the Table:
  • Three or more years of UX design experience. Preference will be given to candidates who have experience designing industrial or process solutions.
  • Expertise in standard UX software such as Figma, Sketch, InVision, etc. Basic coding skills are a plus.
  • Ability to ask the right questions and work with clients to understand detailed requirements and design complete user experiences that meet client needs and vision.
  • Extensive experience in using UX design best practices to design solutions, and a deep understanding of usability and responsive design.
  • A solid grasp of user-centered design (UCD), planning and conducting user research, user testing, A/B testing, rapid prototyping, heuristic analysis, usability and accessibility concerns.
  • Ability to iterate designs and solutions efficiently and intelligently.
  • Ability to clearly and effectively communicate design processes, ideas, and solutions to teams and clients.
  • A clear understanding of the importance of user-centered design and design thinking.
  • Ability to work effectively in a team setting including synthesizing abstract ideas into concrete design implications.
  • Be passionate about resolving user pain points through great design.
  • Research and showcase knowledge in the industry's latest trends and technologies.
